snippet: Democrats are warning supporters that a huge cash advantage mustered by Republican groups could overwhelm President Obama in the fall.
abstract: Pres Obama's allies are under growing pressure to raise money rapidly for Democratic-leaning independent groups, warning his supporters that the huge cash advantage mustered by Republican groups could prove decisive in the presidential election; early indications are that the Democratic super PACs are facing an uphill climb, despite Obama's decision in February to endorse super PAC fund-raising.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and MICHAEL LUO

lead_paragraph: Democrats are warning supporters that a huge cash advantage mustered by Republican groups could overwhelm President Obama in the fall.

headline.seo: Obama Campaign Fears Uphill Climb Raising ‘Super PAC’ Money
headline.main: Obama Campaign Fears Uphill Climb Raising ‘Super PAC’ Money
headline.print_headline: Obama Allies Feel Pressure To Raise Cash
